selected_links.title: Report a Missed Collection - South Hams District Council
strengths: Directly related to assisting customers with missed waste collections.
The title and the snippet clearly suggest its use for reporting missed collections
selected_links.reasoning: As the title and snippet of this link indicate 'Report a Missed Collection', it appears to be the most relevant resource for council customer information needs related to waste collection services.

context.need: I forgot to put my bin out and need to report that I would like it collected.

recommendation.reason: Link appears suitable for user needs
next_steps: Follow the link to access the content

Reasons.need: I forgot to put my bin out and need to report that I would like it collected.
Reasons.answer_quality: The content partially addresses this question. It details when and how reports of missed collections can be made, but does not mention how to request a one-time collection.
Reasons.reasoning: While the article outlines the procedures for reporting missed collections, it does not explicitly state how to ask for an exception or immediate collection when a resident forgets to put their bin out. Although it's possible that residents can call the council to request an extra pickup, this is neither mentioned nor clearly implied in the content.
Reasons.next_actions: If I need to report a missed collection after the specified time frame or require an exception due to forgetting to put my bin out, I would contact the Council through their contact information which is not provided in the text but can typically be found on other pages of the Council's website.

analysis.overall_assessment: The content is useful for understanding how to report a missed collection and relevant timelines, but it doesn't provide a simple solution for residents who need immediate assistance due to forgetting to put their bin out. The content could be improved by briefly mentioning alternatives or additional resources for such situations.
